Other Type Definitions.html#/c:TSKTrustK.name: TSKSupportedAlgorithm
Other Type Definitions.html#/c:TSKTrustK.abstract: DEPRECATED since 1.6.0: this configuration key is no longer needed.

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:TSKTru.abstract: A domain-specific configuration key (to defined for a domain under the kTSKPinnedDomains

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKP.abstract: An array of SSL pins, where each pin is the base64-encoded SHA-256 hash of a certificate’s

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.name: kTSKEnforcePinning
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.abstract: A boolean. If set to NO, TrustKit will not block SSL connections that caused a pin or

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKI.name: kTSKIncludeSubdomains
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKI.abstract: A boolean. If set to YES, also pin all the subdomains of the specified domain; default

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.name: kTSKExcludeSubdomainFromParentPolicy
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.abstract: A boolean. If set to YES, TrustKit will not pin this specific domain if kTSKIncludeSubdomains

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKR.name: kTSKReportUris
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKR.abstract: An array of URLs to which pin validation failures should be reported.

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKD.name: kTSKDisableDefaultReportUri
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKD.abstract: A boolean. If set to YES, the default report URL for sending pin failure reports will

Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.name: kTSKExpirationDate
Domain Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKE.abstract: A string containing the date, in yyyy-MM-dd format, on which the domain’s configured SSL

Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:TSKTru.name: TSKGlobalConfigurationKey
Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:TSKTru.abstract: A global, App-wide configuration key that can be set in the pinning policy.

Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKS.name: kTSKSwizzleNetworkDelegates
Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKS.abstract: A boolean. If set to YES, TrustKit will perform method swizzling on the App’s

Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKP.name: kTSKPinnedDomains
Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKP.abstract: A dictionary with domains (such as www.domain.com) as keys and dictionaries as values.

Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKI.name: kTSKIgnorePinningForUserDefinedTrustAnchors
Global Configuration Keys.html#/c:@kTSKI.abstract: A boolean. If set to YES, pinning validation will be skipped if the server’s certificate

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationSuccess
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust was succesfully evaluated and contained at least one of the configured pins.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationFailedNoMatchingPin
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust was succesfully evaluated but did not contain any of the configured pins.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationFailedInvalidCertificateChain
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust’s evaluation failed: the server’s certificate chain is not trusted.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationErrorInvalidParameters
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust could not be evaluated due to invalid parameters.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationFailedUserDefinedTrustAnchor
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust was succesfully evaluated but did not contain any of the configured pins. However, the certificate chain terminates at a user-defined trust anchor (ie. a custom/private CA that was manually added to the macOS trust store). Only available on macOS.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.name: TSKTrustEvaluationErrorCouldNotGenerateSpkiHash
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html#/c:@.abstract: The server trust could not be evaluated due to an error when trying to generate the certificate’s subject public key info hash. On iOS 9 or below, this could be caused by a Keychain failure when trying to extract the certificate’s public key bytes.

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.name: serverHostname
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.abstract: The hostname of the server SSL pinning validation was performed against.

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.name: evaluationResult
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.abstract: The result of validating the server’s certificate chain against the set of SSL pins configured for

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.name: finalTrustDecision
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.abstract: The trust decision returned for this connection, which describes whether the connection should be blocked

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.name: validationDuration
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.abstract: The time it took for the SSL pinning validation to be performed.

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.name: certificateChain
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html#/.abstract: The certificate chain sent by the server when establishing the connection as PEM-formatted certificates.

Setting up a Validation Callback.html#/c.name: TSKPinningValidatorCallback
Setting up a Validation Callback.html#/c.abstract: A block that can be set in a TrustKit instance to be invoked for every request that is going through

Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html.name: TSKPinningValidatorResult
Classes/TSKPinningValidatorResult.html.abstract: A TSKPinningValidatorResult instance contains all the details regarding a pinning validation

Setting up a Validation Callback.html#/c.name: TKSDomainPinningPolicy
Setting up a Validation Callback.html#/c.abstract: The pinning policy set for a specific hostname.

Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html.name: TSKTrustEvaluationResult
Enums/TSKTrustEvaluationResult.html.abstract: Possible return values when verifying a server’s identity against a set of pins.

Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.name: TSKTrustDecisionShouldAllowConnection
Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.abstract: Based on the server’s certificate chain and the configured pinning policy for this domain, the SSL connection should be allowed.

Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.name: TSKTrustDecisionShouldBlockConnection
Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.abstract: Based on the server’s certificate chain and the configured pinning policy for this domain, the SSL connection should be blocked.

Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.name: TSKTrustDecisionDomainNotPinned
Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html#/c:@E@TSKTru.abstract: No pinning policy was configured for this domain and TrustKit did not validate the server’s identity.

Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html#/c:objc.name: -handleChallenge:completionHandler:
Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html#/c:objc.abstract: Helper method for handling authentication challenges received within a NSURLSessionDelegate, NSURLSessionTaskDelegate or WKNavigationDelegate.

Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html#/c:objc.name: -evaluateTrust:forHostname:
Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html#/c:objc.abstract: Evaluate the supplied server trust against the SSL pinning policy previously configured. If the validation fails, a pin failure report will be sent.

Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html.name: TSKPinningValidator
Classes/TSKPinningValidator.html.abstract: A TSKPinningValidator instance can be used to verify a server’s identity against an SSL pinning policy.

Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html.name: TSKTrustDecision
Enums/TSKTrustDecision.html.abstract: Possible return values when verifying a server’s identity against an SSL pinning policy.

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: +initSharedInstanceWithConfiguration:sharedContainerIdentifier:
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Initialize the global TrustKit singleton with the supplied pinning policy.

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: +sharedInstance
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Retrieve the global TrustKit singleton instance. Raises an exception if +initSharedInstanceWithConfiguration:

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: pinningValidator
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Retrieve the validator instance conforming to the pinning policy of this TrustKit instance.

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: pinningValidatorCallback
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Register a block to be invoked for every request that is going through TrustKit’s pinning

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: pinningValidatorCallbackQueue
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Queue on which to invoke the pinningValidatorCallback; default value is the main queue.

Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.name: -initWithConfiguration:sharedContainerIdentifier:
Classes/TrustKit.html#/c:objc(cs)TrustKi.abstract: Initialize a local TrustKit instance with the supplied SSL pinning policy configuration.

Classes/TrustKit.html.name: TrustKit
Classes/TrustKit.html.abstract: TrustKit is the main class for configuring an SSL pinning policy within an App.

Other Type Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
